translations.english_saheeh: O you who covers himself [with a garment],[1788]
translations.english_hilali_khan: O you (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) enveloped in garments!
translations.english_rwwad: O you covered [in your cloak],

translations.english_saheeh: Arise and warn.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Arise and warn!
translations.english_rwwad: arise and warn,

translations.english_saheeh: And your Lord glorify.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And magnify your Lord (Allâh)!
translations.english_rwwad: and proclaim the greatness of your Lord,

translations.english_saheeh: And your clothing purify.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And purify your garments!
translations.english_rwwad: and purify your garments,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1789]- Specifically, idols or generally, bad conduct and morals.

translations.english_saheeh: And uncleanliness[1789] avoid.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And keep away from Ar-Rujz (the idols)!
translations.english_rwwad: and shun idol worshiping,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1790]- An alternative meaning is "Do not consider any favor you have conferred to be great."

translations.english_saheeh: And do not confer favor to acquire more[1790].
translations.english_hilali_khan: And give not a thing in order to have more (or consider not your deeds of obedience to Allâh as a favour to Him).
translations.english_rwwad: and do not do a favor for a greater return,

translations.english_saheeh: But for your Lord be patient.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And be patient for the sake of your Lord (i.e. perform your duty to Allâh)!
translations.english_rwwad: and be patient for the sake of your Lord.

translations.english_saheeh: And when the trumpet is blown,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then, when the Trumpet is sounded (i.e. the second blowing of the horn).
translations.english_rwwad: When the Trumpet is sounded,

translations.english_saheeh: That Day will be a difficult day
translations.english_hilali_khan: Truly, that Day will be a Hard Day -
translations.english_rwwad: that Day will be a difficult day,

translations.english_saheeh: For the disbelievers - not easy.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Far from easy for the disbelievers.
translations.english_rwwad: not easy for the disbelievers.

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1791]- i.e., without wealth or children.  The reference is to al-Waleed bin al-Mugheerah, who after inclining toward the Qur’ān, denied it publicly in order to win the approval of the Quraysh.

translations.english_saheeh: Leave Me with the one I created alone[1791]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Leave Me Alone (to deal) with whom I created lonely (without any wealth or children etc, i.e. Al-Walîd bin Al-Mughîrah Al-Makhzûmî)!
translations.english_rwwad: Leave me alone to deal with the one whom I created,

translations.english_saheeh: And to whom I granted extensive wealth
translations.english_hilali_khan: And then granted him resources in abundance.
translations.english_rwwad: and gave him abundant wealth,

translations.english_saheeh: And children present [with him]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And children to be by his side.
translations.english_rwwad: and sons by his side,

translations.english_saheeh: And spread [everything] before him, easing [his life].
translations.english_hilali_khan: And made life smooth and comfortable for him.
translations.english_rwwad: and gave him a life of comfort and power,

translations.english_saheeh: Then he desires that I should add more.
translations.english_hilali_khan: After all that he desires that I should give more;
translations.english_rwwad: yet he aspires that I should give him more.

translations.english_saheeh: No! Indeed, he has been toward Our verses obstinate.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nay! Verily, he has been opposing Our Ayât (proofs, evidence, verses, lessons, signs, revelations).
translations.english_rwwad: By no means! For he has been stubborn against Our verses.

translations.english_saheeh: I will cover him with arduous torment.
translations.english_hilali_khan: I shall oblige him to (climb a slippery mountain in the Hell-fire called As-Sa‘ûd, or) face a severe torment!
translations.english_rwwad: I will subject him to an unbearable punishment.

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1792]- About what he would say concerning the Qur’ān and how he might discredit the Prophet (ﷺ).

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, he thought and deliberated.[1792]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, he thought and plotted.
translations.english_rwwad: For he reflected and plotted [against the Qur’an].

translations.english_saheeh: So may he be destroyed [for] how he deliberated.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So let him be cursed: how he plotted!
translations.english_rwwad: May he perish, how he plotted!

translations.english_saheeh: Then may he be destroyed [for] how he deliberated.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And once more let him be cursed: how he plotted!
translations.english_rwwad: Again, may he perish, how he plotted!

translations.english_saheeh: Then he considered [again];
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then he thought.
translations.english_rwwad: Then he looked around,

translations.english_saheeh: Then he frowned and scowled;
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then he frowned and he looked in a bad tempered way;
translations.english_rwwad: then he frowned and scowled,

translations.english_saheeh: Then he turned back and was arrogant
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then he turned back, and was proud.
translations.english_rwwad: then turned away with arrogance,

arabic_text: فَقَالَ إِنۡ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا سِحۡرٞ يُؤۡثَرُ

translations.english_saheeh: And said, "This is not but magic imitated [from others].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then he said: "This is nothing but magic from that of old,
translations.english_rwwad: then said, “This is nothing but magic from the past.

translations.english_saheeh: This is not but the word of a human being."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "This is nothing but the word of a human being!"
translations.english_rwwad: This is nothing but the words of a man.”

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1793]- One of the proper names of Hell.

translations.english_saheeh: I will drive him into Saqar.[1793]
translations.english_hilali_khan: I will cast him into Hell-fire.[1]
translations.english_rwwad: Soon I will make him burn in the Scorching Fire.

translations.english_saheeh: And what can make you know what is Saqar?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And what will make you know (exactly) what Hell-fire is?
translations.english_rwwad: How do you know what Scorching Fire is?

translations.english_saheeh: It lets nothing remain and leaves nothing [unburned],
translations.english_hilali_khan: It spares not (any sinner), nor does it leave (anything unburnt)!
translations.english_rwwad: It leaves nothing and spares no one,

translations.english_saheeh: Altering [i.e., blackening] the skins.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Burning and blackening the skins!
translations.english_rwwad: scorching the skin.

translations.english_saheeh: Over it are nineteen [angels].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Over it are nineteen (angels as guardians and keepers of Hell).
translations.english_rwwad: It is overseen by nineteen [angels].

arabic_text: وَمَا جَعَلۡنَآ أَصۡحَٰبَ ٱلنَّارِ إِلَّا مَلَٰٓئِكَةٗۖ وَمَا جَعَلۡنَا عِدَّتَهُمۡ إِلَّا فِتۡنَةٗ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ لِيَسۡتَيۡقِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُواْ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ وَيَزۡدَادَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓاْ إِيمَٰنٗا وَلَا يَرۡتَابَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُواْ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ وَٱلۡمُؤۡمِنُونَ وَلِيَقُولَ ٱلَّذِينَ فِي قُلُوبِهِم مَّرَضٞ وَٱلۡكَٰفِرُونَ مَاذَآ أَرَادَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَٰذَا مَثَلٗاۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُضِلُّ ٱللَّهُ مَن يَشَآءُ وَيَهۡدِي مَن يَشَآءُۚ وَمَا يَعۡلَمُ جُنُودَ رَبِّكَ إِلَّا هُوَۚ وَمَا هِيَ إِلَّا ذِكۡرَىٰ لِلۡبَشَرِ
phonetic: 74.31 Wa Mā Ja`alnā 'Aşĥāba An-Nāri 'Illā Malā'ikatan Wa Mā Ja`alnā `Iddatahum 'Illā Fitnatan Lilladhīna Kafarū Liyastayqina Al-Ladhīna 'Ūtū Al-Kitāba Wa Yazdāda Al-Ladhīna 'Āmanū 'Īmānāan Wa Lā Yartāba Al-Ladhīna 'Ūtū Al-Kitāba Wa Al-Mu'uminūna Wa Liyaqūla Al-Ladhīna Fī Qulūbihim Marađun Wa Al-Kāfirūna Mādhā 'Arāda Allāhu Bihadhā Mathalāan Kadhālika Yuđillu Allāhu Man Yashā'u Wa Yahdī Man Yashā'u Wa Mā Ya`lamu Junūda Rabbika 'Illā Huwa Wa Mā Hiya 'Illā Dhikrá Lilbashari

translations.english_saheeh: And We have not made the keepers of the Fire except angels. And We have not made their number except as a trial for those who disbelieve - that those who were given the Scripture will be convinced and those who have believed will increase in faith and those who were given the Scripture and the believers will not doubt and that those in whose hearts is disease [i.e., hypocrisy] and the disbelievers will say, "What does Allāh intend by this as an example?" Thus does Allāh send astray whom He wills and guide whom He wills. And none knows the soldiers of your Lord except Him. And it [i.e., mention of the Fire] is not but a reminder to humanity.
translations.english_hilali_khan: which is written in the Taurât (Torah) and the Injeel (Gospel)] and that the believers may increase in Faith (as this Qur’ân is the truth), and that no doubt may be left for the people of the Scripture and the believers, and that those in whose hearts is a disease (of hypocrisy) and the disbelievers may say: "What Allâh intends by this (curious) example ?" Thus Allâh leads astray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And none can know the hosts of your Lord but He. And this (Hell) is nothing else than a (warning) reminder to mankind.
translations.english_rwwad: We have only appointed angels as keepers of the Fire, and We have only made their number as a test for the disbelievers, so that those who were given the Scripture may have certainty and the believers may increase in faith; and neither those who were given the Scripture nor the believers may have any doubts; and so that those [hypocrites] in whose hearts is sickness and the disbelievers may say, “What does Allah mean by this number?” Thus Allah causes to stray whom He wills and guides whom He wills, and none knows the soldiers of your Lord but He. This is but a reminder to mankind.

translations.english_saheeh: No! By the moon.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nay! And by the moon
translations.english_rwwad: No indeed! By the moon,

translations.english_saheeh: And [by] the night when it departs.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And by the night when it withdraws.
translations.english_rwwad: and by the night when it departs,

translations.english_saheeh: And [by] the morning when it brightens,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And by the dawn when it brightens.
translations.english_rwwad: and by the dawn when it brightens,

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, it [i.e., the Fire] is of the greatest [afflictions].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, it (Hell, or their denial of Prophet Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم, or the Day of Resurrection) is but one of the greatest (signs).
translations.english_rwwad: Hellfire is indeed one of the greatest matters,

translations.english_saheeh: As a warning to humanity -
translations.english_hilali_khan: A warning to mankind -
translations.english_rwwad: a warning to mankind,

arabic_text: لِمَن شَآءَ مِنكُمۡ أَن يَتَقَدَّمَ أَوۡ يَتَأَخَّرَ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1794]- To righteousness by acceptance of the warning.

translations.english_saheeh: To whoever wills among you to proceed[1794] or stay behind.
translations.english_hilali_khan: To any of you that chooses to go forward (by working righteous deeds), or to remain behind (by committing sins).
translations.english_rwwad: to whoever among you chooses to advance or regress.

translations.english_saheeh: Every soul, for what it has earned, will be retained[1795].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Every person is a pledge for what he has earned,
translations.english_rwwad: Every soul is held in pledge for its deeds,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1796]- i.e., the righteous who receive their records in their right hands.

translations.english_saheeh: Except the companions of the right,[1796].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Except those on the Right, (i.e. the pious true believers of Islâmic Monotheism).
translations.english_rwwad: except the People of the Right,

translations.english_saheeh: [Who will be] in gardens, questioning each other
translations.english_hilali_khan: In Gardens (Paradise) they will ask one another,
translations.english_rwwad: who will be in gardens, asking one another

translations.english_saheeh: About the criminals,
translations.english_hilali_khan: About Al-Mujrimûn (polytheists, criminals, disbelievers), (And they will say to them):
translations.english_rwwad: about the wicked:

translations.english_saheeh: [And asking them], "What put you into Saqar?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: "What has caused you to enter Hell?"
translations.english_rwwad: “What brought you to Hell?”

translations.english_saheeh: They will say, "We were not of those who prayed,
translations.english_hilali_khan: They will say: "We were not of those who used to offer the Salât (prayers),[2]
translations.english_rwwad: They will say, “We were not among those who prayed,

translations.english_saheeh: Nor did we used to feed the poor.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Nor we used to feed Al-Miskîn (the poor);
translations.english_rwwad: nor did we feed the poor,

translations.english_saheeh: And we used to enter into vain discourse with those who engaged [in it],
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And we used to talk falsehood (all that which Allâh hated) with vain talkers.[3]
translations.english_rwwad: and we indulged in falsehood along with those who indulged in it,

translations.english_saheeh: And we used to deny the Day of Recompense
translations.english_hilali_khan: And we used to belie the Day of Recompense,[4]
translations.english_rwwad: and we denied the Day of Judgment,

translations.english_saheeh: Until there came to us the certainty [i.e., death]."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Until there came to us (the death) that is certain."
translations.english_rwwad: until the certainty [of death] came to us.”

translations.english_saheeh: So there will not benefit them the intercession of [any] intercessors.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So no intercession of intercessors will be of any use to them.
translations.english_rwwad: So the intercession of intercessors will not benefit them.

translations.english_saheeh: Then what is [the matter] with them that they are, from the reminder, turning away.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then what is wrong with them (i.e. the polytheists, the disbelievers) that they turn away from (receiving) admonition?
translations.english_rwwad: Then what is the matter with them that they turn away from the Reminder,

translations.english_saheeh: As if they were alarmed donkeys.
translations.english_hilali_khan: As if they were (frightened) wild donkeys.
translations.english_rwwad: as if they were terrified wild asses,

translations.english_saheeh: Fleeing from a lion?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Fleeing from a hunter, or a lion, or a beast of prey.
translations.english_rwwad: fleeing from a lion?

arabic_text: بَلۡ يُرِيدُ كُلُّ ٱمۡرِيٕٖ مِّنۡهُمۡ أَن يُؤۡتَىٰ صُحُفٗا مُّنَشَّرَةٗ
phonetic: 74.52 Bal Yurīdu Kullu Amri'in Minhum 'An Yu'utá Şuĥufāan Munasharahan

footnotes.english_saheeh:
[1797]- Instead of Muḥammad (ﷺ).
[1798]- i.e., made public.  Much of their refusal of his message was due to envy and jealousy of the Prophet (ﷺ).

translations.english_saheeh: Rather, every person among them desires that he[1797] would be given scriptures spread about.[1798]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nay, everyone of them desires that he should be given pages spread out (coming from Allâh with a writing that Islâm is the right religion, and Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم has come with the truth from Allâh, the Lord of the heavens and earth).
translations.english_rwwad: In fact, each one of them desires that open [divine] letters be sent to each of them.

translations.english_saheeh: No! But they do not fear the Hereafter.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nay! But they fear not the Hereafter (from Allâh’s punishment).
translations.english_rwwad: By no means! They rather do not fear the Hereafter.

translations.english_saheeh: No! Indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is a reminder.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nay, verily, this (Qur’an) is an admonition,
translations.english_rwwad: No indeed! This [Qur’an] is a reminder.

translations.english_saheeh: Then whoever wills will remember it.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So whosoever will (let him read it), and receive admonition (from it)!
translations.english_rwwad: So whoever wills may take heed.

arabic_text: وَمَا يَذۡكُرُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُۚ هُوَ أَهۡلُ ٱلتَّقۡوَىٰ وَأَهۡلُ ٱلۡمَغۡفِرَةِ
phonetic: 74.56 Wa Mā Yadhkurūna 'Illā 'An Yashā'a Allāhu Huwa 'Ahlu At-Taqwá Wa 'Ahlu Al-Maghfirahi

translations.english_saheeh: And they will not remember except that Allāh wills. He is worthy of fear and adequate for [granting] forgiveness.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And they will not receive admonition unless Allâh wills; He (Allâh) is the One, deserving that mankind should be afraid of, and should be dutiful to Him, and should not take any Ilâh (god) along with Him, and He is the One Who forgives (sins).
translations.english_rwwad: But they will not take heed unless Allah so wills. He is most worthy to be feared and most worthy to forgive.
